body.p: Some respondents to the 2008 ED were concerned that qualitative disclosure of individually significant related party transactions alone would not meet the objective of IAS 24 and that combining individually significant transactions with collectively significant transactions would not provide sufficient transparency. The Board concluded that it should require an entity to disclose:

li.p: the nature and amount of each individually significant transaction; and
quantitative or qualitative information about other types of transactions that are collectively, but not individually, significant.
